intro: Allowissadula rosei, commonly known as the rose sea hare, is a species of sea slug found in the Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its soft, gelatinous body covered in a layer of mucus. The animal has a distinctive pink or reddish coloration, which helps it blend into its marine environment. It feeds primarily on algae and is often found in shallow coastal waters. This species plays an important role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the grazing of algae and serving as prey for various marine predators.
